radiographic_examinations.findings: The bases of the lungs are clear without nodules or consolidations. There is no pleural effusion. There is a subcentimeter hypodensity in the dome of the right lobe of the liver, measuring 7 mm, likely a hepatic cyst or biliary hamartoma. The portal vein is patent. The gallbladder is collapsed and normal in appearance. No intra- or extra-hepatic biliary duct dilation. The spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are normal. The kidneys are normal without renal masses, pyelonephritis, or hydronephrosis. The stomach and small bowel are normal in caliber with no evidence of obstruction. The appendix is fluid-filled and thickened, measuring up to 10 mm, with a hyperemic wall and significant surrounding stranding. No evidence of a walled-off fluid collection or perforation. The remainder of the large bowel is normal. No free fluid in the pelvis or lymphadenopathy. No concerning lytic or sclerotic osseous lesions or fractures.
